bug.author: MuhammadAsadJaved
bug.summary: Unable to test / detect Yolov4-Tiny trained on Darknet
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
I have trained a Yolov4-tiny model for 2 classes. Now I am trying to test/detect that model in your project. I am using the same .cfg, weights, data and names. <denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce (REQUIRED)</denchmark-h>
Input: <denchmark-code>ython test.py --cfg V4_Tiny_Security/yolov4-tiny.cfg --data V4_Tiny_Security/v4tiny_anchor-Security-visual.data --weights V4_Tiny_Security/yolov4-tiny-Security-visual_last.weights
</denchmark-code>
Output: <denchmark-code>Traceback (most recent call last): File "test.py", line 254, in <module> test(opt.cfg, File "test.py", line 35, in test model = Darknet(cfg, imgsz) File "/home/abc/yolov3/models.py", line 231, in __init__ self.module_defs = parse_model_cfg(cfg) File "/home/abc/yolov3/utils/parse_config.py", line 50, in parse_model_cfg assert not any(u), "Unsupported fields %s in %s. See https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/issues/631" % (u, path) AssertionError: Unsupported fields ['group_id', 'resize'] in V4_Tiny_Security/yolov4-tiny.cfg. See https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/issues/631
</denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
I have tried the issue <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/issues/631>#631</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/issues/1350>#1350</denchmark-link> but that solution is old and this project is updated, so that changes are not applicable. <denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.
OS: Ubuntu GPU: TITAN V
<denchmark-h:h2>Additional context</denchmark-h>
How I can do this task? Do I need to train model using this repo with your official yolov4-tiny.cfg? Note: I am able to test/detect Yolov3 without any problem, the problem is only with Yolov4-Tiny

comments.comment: This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
